text: Joseph Medicine Crow-High Bird (October 27, 1913 - April 3, 2016) was a Crow historian and author. He was also an enrolled member of the Crow Nation of Native Americans. His writings on Native American history and reservation culture are thought to be his best known works, but he was best known for his writings and lectures about the Battle of the Little Bighorn. He turned 100 in October 2013.
